text:
The registry key was never set or changed by the update; the process allowed you to add it to manually override the default setting (which changed depending on the progression of the update phases). Now that it has entered the “full enforcement” phase with the October 10 update, the registry key is ignored. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/topic/kb5020805-how-to-manage-kerberos-protocol-changes-related-to-cve-2022-37967-997e9acc-67c5-48e1-8d0d-190269bf4efb
 Jody MacKercher Positron Computer Services %40BN8PR05MB6242.namprd05.prod.outlook.com

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] October updates and Kerberos
